boat.name: Molly
boat.full_description:
Used by the Henley Whalers, a leading sail-and-oar group based at Henley on Thames. Molly's rig has been reduced from the original to facilitate towing and up to ten oars rather than the traditional five.

Molly remains unballasted, thus necessitating a large crew under sail. She is regularly trailed to events across Europe including Venice, Netherlands, Morbian, Douarnenez, Milford Haven, Scotland's Great Glen, Ireland and the Solent.

She has made appearances in The Great River Race, the Vogalonga and the Eddystone Challenge. In 2012 she was rowed in the Queen's Diamond Jubilee Pageant and the Olympic Torch Relay.
boat.short_description: Built in 2003, Molly is a modern replica of a New Bedford whaleboat designed by Charles Beetle.
